name: Staying Cool at the Rotunda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated to a break here and given a gift voucher to redeem. As a result we booked over the phone via the company and paid the full rate plus extra as we decided that we wanted to stay in the Clubman apartment. This had outside space, and as we were staying there in July, we hoped for good weather. We were fortunate that the weather was fabulous, so I felt that we had booked wisely.
reviews.title: The overall experience could have been better and more professional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checking in, after some initial confusion about the booking and an initial insistence by the receptionist that they had no knowledge of the (already paid for voucher), I was told we were given a complementary upgrade. When I enquired as to whether the upgrade had a balcony, I was told it didn't. I requested the original apartment pointing out that we would be wanting to benefit from the use of the terrace. Initially the young woman seemed unsure if this was still available. Luckily it was.
reviews.title: Mostly brilliant

reviews.text: My first impression was that although the internal design was great, the colour scheme, black floors and white walls in the bedroom consequently resulted in marks,stains and wear and tear being more apparent. However in general, the facilities in the apartment were great and my first impressions were good.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: The outside space was absolutely huge, but again the exterior walls and the novelty bull(!) were really quite dirty which marred the overall affect. This in itself wasn't a massive issue. However what was an issue was that the astroturf was littered with used cigarette butts and an empty cigarette packet. When I went back down to reception to request that this be dealt with, the receptionist stated that it wasn't her job and that the cleaning staff had left for the day so it would not be cleaned until the following day. Moreover she stated that the litter was more than likely caused by the residents of the building in the apartments on the upper floors and it was therefore not their responsibility. I had to then have an argument with her until she finally agreed to do it. Maybe I am being unreasonable but when the weekend rate is £379, I didn't think this was being too demanding.
reviews.title: Great view and lots of nice touches for a comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally though we really liked the vibe of this apartment, the location was excellent and the extra's such as the bathrobes, luxury toiletries and basics in the kitchen were great but there were too many customer service issues that couldn't justify the rate that the website charges. Had it not been for the problems when we checked in, this would have received 4 stars but when basic cleaning hasn't been done and I have to have an argument in order to ensure that it is, that is really not good enough.
reviews.title: Ace, great cereals and fresh orange juice too

reviews.text: Stayed for one night only at the end of July after reading the rave reviews and was certainly not disappointed.Having stayed in many top hotels over the years ,this was by far the best place I have been to in a long while.The staff ,standard of accommodation and view was exceptional and I would certainly stay again and am already planning my next trip as I was also impressed by Birmingham as a whole.My only regret was that I did not stay for longer.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped in a Mini apartment. We loved the location (10-15 mins walk from everything), view, the room, the design details, the bed! and history of the building. The concierge where also very friendly and helpful. Loved the extra details like the juicer and the espresso machine. Some niggles like the shower tray filling with water (blocked), wet floor in the bathroom room after taking a shower, the ventilation not working properly losing it a star. We would definitely go back and recommended.
reviews.title: Amazing place.
Stunning views, fabulous penthouse apartment
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the Roadster apartment at the top of the building for two nights and we were blown away by the stunning views over Birmingham. Drinking a glass of champagne on the balcony while watching the moon and the evening lights come on over Birmingham is something we will treasure for a long time.

The apartment itself was spacious and had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay. Despite being in a central location the Rotunda is relatively quiet at night and we had a very restful sleep. The service was also excellent and we found the receptionist to be more friendly and helpful than the service we received from hotels we've stayed in recently.
reviews.title: No point staying in a hotel in Birmingham - stay here instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to return soon there were a couple of niggles. Some of the items in the apartment are starting to show their age. Despite being designer pieces, the chairs in the living area are looking a bit tatty and there were a few stains on the bedroom carpet that need to be sorted out.
reviews.title: Awesome - again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the mini apartments last week for just one night. We loved the whole experience - from the lovely welcoming welcome, to the amazing views (19th floor and floor to ceiling windows), to the lovely little kitchen, comfy bed and trendy decor and the little special touches like the fresh oranges for the juicer, nice cereals, fluffy bathrobes and the fact that the bags we dropped off at noon when we arrived in Birmingham were taken up our room ahead of us checking in.
reviews.title: Amazing little aprtment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great - we looked down directly onto the famous bull of the bullring.
reviews.title: A safe haven within the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't fault it and look forward to visiting again.
reviews.title: A stressful situation well resolved in the end after 2 trips!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived back from a 2 night stay here. The reason for our stay was the wife's birthday. When booking they did not have any penthouse apartments available, but with a brief note on my booking form - as soon as one became available we were placed in one. (this customer service carried on through out the stay)
reviews.title: FANTASTIC 24 HOURS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I understand the hotel does not have its own car park, and having never been to Birmingham before we felt the center of attention walking through the Bullring with our cases. (although we did see other people enduring the same walk during our stay) We had a little trouble finding the hotel. Maybe some sort of printable map they could send out on booking wouldn't go a miss.
reviews.title: Dishonoured booking through Late Rooms

reviews.text: Splashed out !!!!!! significant bucks for a penthouse on the 20th floor and it was... well it was OK. Amazing views obviously but other than that didn't really offer much for the money. It was as expected no more. Nothing here to really WOW and there was a lot that I thought shouldn't have slipped under housekeeping's radar
reviews.title: Great Penthouse View.. but for the price???

reviews.text: 1) A window that should have opened but the locking mechanism was broken
reviews.title: Definitely the coolest place to stay in Birmingham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) a bag of ice in the freezer that was opened and used
reviews.title: Location, Location,Location!!!!

reviews.text: 3) some damage to tiles and grout in the main bathroom
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4) the car part entry system is a pain because you can't park in the road but you have to run back to reception around the corner to give your entry fob back.. Surely a little drop box would help.
reviews.title: Love it!

aka: Staying Cool At The Rotunda Hotel Birmingham
description: Staying Cool's stunning apartments on the top three floors of the refurbished Rotunda offer amazing views of the city, just three minutes from New Street and Moor Street Stations and right next door to Selfridges. Each apartment has floor-to-ceiling glass windows that open fully and the four Penthouses have their own private open balconies on the very top floor. These stylish apartments have been designed with maximum comfort in mind. Each comes with bespoke designer furniture, a very well-equipped Poggenpohl kitchen, Gaggia espresso maker with complimentary locally sourced milk and Illy or Fairtrade coffee, oranges for the juicer, Apple Mac, iPod dock, plus a king size bed with pocket sprung/memory foam mattress for the very best night's sleep. There's a 24 hour reception plus daytime/evening concierge offering Staying Cool's renowned service. Choose from Minis (studios), Clubmans (one beds), Maxis (two beds) and Roadsters (two bed Penthouses).
